elphem.common package

Submodules

elphem.common.atomic_weight module

class elphem.common.atomic_weight.AtomicWeight[source]

Bases: object

Provides a table of atomic weights and a method to retrieve the atomic masses based on a list of atomic symbols.

table

Dictionary mapping atomic symbols to their average atomic masses.

Type:

dict

classmethod get_from_list(atomic_names: list) → list[source]

Returns a list of atomic masses corresponding to the given list of atomic symbols.

Parameters:

atomic_names (list of str) – A list of atomic symbols.

Returns:

A list of atomic masses corresponding to the atomic symbols.

Return type:

list of float

Raises:

  • TypeError – If the input is not a list or if the elements of the list are not strings.

  • ValueError – If one or more atomic symbols in the list are invalid.

Examples

>>> AtomicWeight.get_from_list(['H', 'He', 'Li'])
[1.008, 4.002602, 6.94]
table = {'Ag': 107.86822, 'Al': 26.9815384, 'Ar': 39.95, 'As': 74.9215956, 'Au': 196.9665704, 'B': 10.81, 'Ba': 137.3277, 'Be': 9.0121831, 'Br': 79.904, 'C': 12.011, 'Ca': 40.078, 'Cd': 112.4144, 'Ce': 140.1161, 'Cl': 35.45, 'Co': 58.9331943, 'Cr': 51.9961, 'Cs': 132.905451966, 'Cu': 63.5463, 'Dy': 162.5001, 'Er': 167.2593, 'Eu': 151.9641, 'F': 18.99840316, 'Fe': 55.8452, 'Ga': 69.7231, 'Gd': 157.253, 'Ge': 72.6308, 'H': 1.008, 'He': 4.002602, 'Hf': 178.4866, 'Hg': 200.5923, 'Ho': 164.9303295, 'I': 126.904473, 'In': 114.8181, 'Ir': 192.2172, 'K': 39.0983, 'Kr': 83.7982, 'La': 138.905477, 'Li': 6.94, 'Lu': 174.96681, 'Mg': 24.305, 'Mn': 54.9380432, 'Mo': 95.951, 'N': 14.007, 'Na': 22.98976928, 'Nb': 92.906371, 'Nd': 144.2423, 'Ne': 20.1797, 'Ni': 58.69344, 'O': 15.999, 'Os': 190.233, 'P': 30.973762, 'Pd': 106.421, 'Pm': 145, 'Pr': 140.907661, 'Pt': 195.0849, 'Rb': 85.46783, 'Re': 186.2071, 'Rh': 102.905492, 'Ru': 101.072, 'S': 32.06, 'Sb': 121.7601, 'Sc': 44.955907, 'Se': 78.9718, 'Si': 28.085, 'Sm': 150.362, 'Sn': 118.7107, 'Sr': 87.621, 'Ta': 180.947882, 'Tb': 158.9253547, 'Tc': 97, 'Te': 127.603, 'Ti': 47.867, 'Tl': 204.38, 'Tm': 168.9342195, 'V': 50.9415, 'W': 183.841, 'Xe': 131.2936, 'Y': 88.9058382, 'Yb': 173.0451, 'Zn': 65.382, 'Zr': 91.2242}

elphem.common.brillouin module

class elphem.common.brillouin.SpecialPoints1D[source]

Bases: object

Defines immutable sets of special points in first Brillouin zone for different types of 1D crystal lattices.

Gamma

Immutable set containing the Gamma point.

Type:

MappingProxyType

Line

Immutable set of special points for the lattice.

Type:

MappingProxyType

Gamma = mappingproxy({'G': 0})
Line = mappingproxy({'G': 0, 'X': 0.5})
class elphem.common.brillouin.SpecialPoints2D[source]

Bases: object

Defines immutable sets of special points in first Brillouin zone for different types of 2D crystal lattices.

Gamma

Immutable set containing the Gamma point.

Type:

MappingProxyType

Square

Immutable set of special points for the square lattice.

Type:

MappingProxyType

Hexagonal

Immutable set of special points for the hexagonal lattice.

Type:

MappingProxyType

Gamma = mappingproxy({'G': (0, 0)})
Hexagonal = mappingproxy({'G': (0, 0), 'M': (0.5, 0), 'K': (-0.3333333333333333, 0.6666666666666666)})
Square = mappingproxy({'G': (0, 0), 'X': (0.5, 0), 'M': (0.5, 0.5)})
class elphem.common.brillouin.SpecialPoints3D[source]

Bases: object

Defines immutable sets of special points in first Brillouin zone for different types of 3D crystal lattices.

Gamma

Immutable set containing the Gamma point.

Type:

MappingProxyType

SC

Immutable set of special points for the simple cubic lattice.

Type:

MappingProxyType

FCC

Immutable set of special points for the face-centered cubic lattice.

Type:

MappingProxyType

BCC

Immutable set of special points for the body-centered cubic lattice.

Type:

MappingProxyType

Hexagonal

Immutable set of special points for the hexagonal lattice.

Type:

MappingProxyType

BCC = mappingproxy({'G': (0, 0, 0), 'H': (-0.5, 0.5, 0.5), 'P': (0.25, 0.25, 0.25), 'N': (0, 0.5, 0)})
FCC = mappingproxy({'G': (0, 0, 0), 'X': (0, 0.5, 0.5), 'L': (0.5, 0.5, 0.5), 'W': (0.25, 0.75, 0.5), 'U': (0.25, 0.625, 0.625), 'K': (0.375, 0.75, 0.375)})
Gamma = mappingproxy({'G': (0, 0, 0)})
Hexagonal = mappingproxy({'G': (0, 0, 0), 'A': (0, 0, 0.5), 'K': (0.6666666666666666, 0.3333333333333333, 0), 'H': (0.6666666666666666, 0.3333333333333333, 0.5), 'M': (0.5, 0, 0), 'L': (0.5, 0, 0.5)})
SC = mappingproxy({'G': (0, 0, 0), 'R': (0.5, 0.5, 0.5), 'X': (0, 0.5, 0), 'M': (0.5, 0.5, 0)})

elphem.common.distribution module

elphem.common.distribution.boltzmann_distribution(temperature: float, energy: float | ndarray) → float | ndarray[source]

Calculates the occupation number of particles following the Boltzmann distribution.

Parameters:

  • temperature (float) – Temperature in Kelvin.

  • energy (float | np.ndarray) – Energy value(s) in Hartree atomic units.

Returns:

Occupation number(s) based on the Boltzmann distribution.

Return type:

float | np.ndarray

elphem.common.distribution.bose_distribution(temperature: float, energy: float | ndarray) → float | ndarray[source]

Calculates the occupation number of particles following the Bose-Einstein distribution.

Parameters:

  • temperature (float) – Temperature in Kelvin.

  • energy (float | np.ndarray) – Energy value(s) in Hartree atomic units.

Returns:

Occupation number(s) based on the Bose-Einstein distribution.

Return type:

float | np.ndarray

elphem.common.distribution.fermi_distribution(temperature: float, energy: float | ndarray) → float | ndarray[source]

Calculates the occupation number of particles following the Fermi-Dirac distribution.

Parameters:

  • temperature (float) – Temperature in Kelvin.

  • energy (float | np.ndarray) – Energy value(s) in Hartree atomic units.

Returns:

Occupation number(s) based on the Fermi-Dirac distribution.

Return type:

float | np.ndarray

elphem.common.distribution.gaussian_distribution(sigma: float, energy: float | ndarray) → float | ndarray[source]

Calculates the probability density of particles following the Gaussian distribution.

Parameters:

  • sigma (float) – Standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution.

  • energy (float | np.ndarray) – Energy value(s) to evaluate the Gaussian function.

Returns:

Probability density(s) based on the Gaussian distribution.

Return type:

float | np.ndarray

elphem.common.function module

elphem.common.function.safe_divide(a: ndarray | float | int, b: ndarray | float | int, default=nan) → ndarray[source]

Safely divides two numbers, arrays, or a combination thereof, with optional handling of division by zero.

Parameters:

  • a (np.ndarray | complex | float | int) – Numerator, can be a number or an array.

  • b (np.ndarray | complex | float | int) – Denominator, can be a number or an array.

  • default (complex | float | int, optional) – Value to use when division by zero occurs. Default is NaN.

Returns:

Result of the division (a / b), with division by zero handled gracefully.

Return type:

np.ndarray

class elphem.common.unit.AtomicUnits[source]

Bases: object

Utility class for atomic unit conversions.

static convert(unit: float, value: float) → dict[source]

Converts a value to and from a base unit to facilitate comparisons and calculations.

Parameters:

  • unit (float) – The unit to which the conversion is based.

  • value (float) – The value to be converted.

Returns:

A dictionary containing converted values.

Return type:

dict

class elphem.common.unit.Byte[source]

Bases: object

Digital information units based on powers of 2.

EXA = 1152921504606846976
GIGA = 1073741824
KILO = 1024
MEGA = 1048576
PETA = 1125899906842624
TERA = 1099511627776
static get_str(size: int) → str[source]

Returns a human-readable string representation of digital information sizes, scaled to appropriate unit.

Parameters:

size (int) – Size in bytes.

Returns:

Formatted string representing the size in appropriate unit (e.g., KB, MB).

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError – If size is negative or too large to be represented.
